n.1: an idea that is implied or suggested
n.0: what you must know in order to determine the reference of an expression

a.1: providing no shelter or sustenance; "bare rocky hills"; "barren lands"; "the bleak treeless regions of the high Andes"; "the desolate surface of the moon"; "a stark landscape"
a.0: offering little or no hope; "the future looked black"; "prospects were bleak"; "Life in the Aran Islands has always been bleak and difficult"- J.M.Synge; "took a dim view of things"
a.2: unpleasantly cold and damp; "bleak winds of the North Atlantic"

v.4: believe to be the case; "I understand you have no previous experience?"
v.1: draw from specific cases for more general cases
v.3: guess correctly; solve by guessing; "He guessed the right number of beans in the jar and won the prize"
v.0: reason by deduction; establish by deduction

n.1: the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression; the class of objects that an expression refers to; "the extension of `satellite of Mars' is the set containing only Demos and Phobos"
n.0: the act of indicating or pointing out by name

r.1: in an unconcerned manner; "glanced casually at the headlines"
r.0: in a composed and unconcerned manner; "without more ado Barker borrowed a knife from his brigade Major and honed it on a carborundum stone as coolly as a butcher"
